Executive Order on Southern Border Progress

Overview: This executive order addresses the situation at the southern border. The overall impact on higher education institutions is expected to be low.

Bottom Line: Universities should monitor the order for any administrative compliance changes.

Key Impacts on Higher Education:

Administrative compliance: Potential new compliance requirements related to the border situation

Affected Departments:

Government Affairs, University Counsel, International Affairs

Action Plan:

Action Required: No, unless specific guidance is issued for higher education institutions

Immediate Steps (0-30 days):

  • Notify relevant departments of the executive order

Short-term Actions (1-3 months):

  • Monitor DHS and State Department for any related policy changes

Long-term Considerations:

  • Incorporate any new compliance requirements into administrative processes

Resource Requirements:

Personnel: No additional personnel needed at this time

Budget: No immediate budget impact

Technology: No new technology required

External Expertise: Consult immigration counsel if specific guidance is issued
